title: Ticket #5280: Need to set cgroup hard memory limit for memsw limit to work
description:
If an admin has set a soft memory limit for a cgroup-enabled slot, then setting the memory + swap limit often fails. This is because the kernel prohibits setting memory + swap lower than the hard limit, and if we haven't set the hard limit, the default is often infinite.

So, when setting the memory + swap limit, if condor only has a soft limit, we will also set the hard limit to be memory + swap minus one page.
